mlp

Class LatexUnicode

  • java.lang.Object
    • mlp.LatexUnicode

  • public class LatexUnicode
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class for reading a file that has Unicodes and corresponding Latex commands/macros along with a brief description for each code, in a "raw" form, and returning a clean version of that.

    • Method Detail

      • cleanRawTexUnicodeData

        public static void cleanRawTexUnicodeData(java.lang.String inputfile,
                                          java.lang.String outputfile)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Reads raw Tex-and-Unicode symbols from the specified input file, cleans the data and converts it into a tidy format, and writes the results in the specified file.
        Parameters:
        inputfile - the name of the file containing the Unicode-Tex mapping and explanations. Each meaningful line starts with a Unicode (u+XXXXX) and has a Latex command followed by explanations. Most of the commands are from imported packages, not native to Latex/Tex.
        outputfile - the output file where the cleaned and tidy data is stored.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the input file could be read from or the output file could be written into.

      • cleanRawTexUnicodeData

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> cleanRawTexUnicodeData(java.lang.String inputfile)
                                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a file where each meaningful line starts with a Unicode (u+XXXXX) and has a Latex command followed by explanations. Most of the latex commands are macros rather than native Latex commands.
        Parameters:
        inputfile - the name of the file containing the unicode-Latex mapping and explanations
        Returns:
        a List (of Strings) of the meaningful lines.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the input file could be read from

      • createUnicodeMathMap

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,FeatureSet> createUnicodeMathMap(java.lang.String inputfile)
                                                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the input file where each non-header line is of the form:
        unicode <> TeX command <> source <> description
        A header line is one that ends with ":" and does not not start with a unicode (u+XXXXX). It turns each non-header line into a Map entry, where the key is the TeX command, and the value is a FeatureSet, where the features are:
        • Category (whose feature value can be opening delimiter, closing delimiter, fence, punctuation, accent, operator, operation, relation, letter, digit, etc.)
        • Unicode (whose value is the uncode of the corresponding symbol)
        • Description (which gives a brief description of the symbol)
        • Source (which can be: Tex, Latex, amssymb, or unicode-math and possibly other features related to font, alphabet and case (if letter), Subcategory (e.g., arrows, geometric shapes) etc.
        Parameters:
        inputfile - the name of the file containing the input
        Returns:
        a Map<String,FeatureSet>, one entry per non-header line in the specified file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the input file could be read from

      • createStructuredUnicodeMathDB

        public static void createStructuredUnicodeMathDB(java.lang.String inputfile,
                                                 java.lang.String outputfile)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the input file where each non-header line is of the form:
        unicode <> TeX command <> source <> description
        A header line is one that ends with ":" and does not not start with a unicode (u+XXXXX). It turns each non-header line into a multi-line entry, one entry per symbols and its features, where the features are:
        • Category (whose feature value can be opening delimiter, closing delimiter, fence, punctuation, accent, operator, operation, relation, letter, digit, etc.)
        • Unicode (whose value is the uncode of the corresponding symbol)
        • Description (which gives a brief description of the symbol)
        • Source (which can be: Tex, Latex, amssymb, or unicode-math and possibly other features related to font, alphabet and case (if letter), Subcategory (e.g., arrows, gemetric shapes) etc.
        Parameters:
        inputfile - the name of the file containing the input
        outputfile - the name of the file where the structured entries are written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the input file could be read from or the output file could be written into.

      • getStatistics

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getStatistics(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,FeatureSet> map)
        It computes the number of Unicode-math symbols in each category of symbols in the input.
        Parameters:
        map - containing cmd-features entries.
        Returns:
        a map, one entry per category, where for each category it associate an integer count of the number of Unicode-math symbols that belong to that category. Also, it puts an entry ["NumberOfSymbols", number of unicode-math symbols in the input map].
